segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and I feel bad for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on her task that she doesn’t even notice the water at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really tired or just completely overwhelmed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, and she has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel sorry for her, standing there in the mess, oblivious to everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring, the stool is wobbling, and she’s just polishing a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she would take a break and see what’s really going on around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is risking a fall, and the girl is encouraging him, but the woman is missing it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like she deserves better than this chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around soon and notices what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR
